org.wikipedia
Class FbotUtil

java.lang.Object
  org.wikipedia.FbotUtil

public class FbotUtil
extends java.lang.Object

Miscellaneous utility methods for Fbot. Contains many non-wiki related functions whose uses extend beyond Wikis.

See Also:
Fbot, MBot, FbotParse
Author:
Fastily

generateRandomString

public static java.lang.String generateRandomString(int len)
Returns a randomized String [A-Z].

Parameters:

Returns:
The random string

arraySplitter

public static java.lang.String[][] arraySplitter(java.lang.String[] z,
                                                 int splits)
Splits an array of Strings into an array of smaller arrays. Useful for multithreaded bots. CAVEAT: if splits > z.length, splits will be set to z.length.

Parameters:
z - The array we'll be splitting
splits - The number of sub-arrays you want.

listFilesR

public static void listFilesR(java.io.File dir,
                              java.util.ArrayList<java.io.File> fl)
Recursively fetches a list of Wiki-uploadable files in contained in the specified directory and its subfolders.

Parameters:
dir - The top directory to start with
fl - The ArrayList to add the files we found to.
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If dir is not a directory.

arrayContains

public static boolean arrayContains(java.lang.Object[] array,
                                    java.lang.Object el)
Checks to see if an array of objects contains a given element

Parameters:
array - The array to check
el - The element to look for in this array
Returns:
True if this array contains the element, else false.

buildReasonCollection

public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> buildReasonCollection(java.lang.String path)
                                                                                  throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
Creates a HashMap from a file. Key and Value must be separated by colons. One newline per entry. Example line: "KEY:VALUE". Useful for storing deletion/editing reasons.

Parameters:
path - The path of the file to read from
Returns:
The HashMap we created by parsing the file
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException

listElementContains

public static boolean listElementContains(java.lang.String[] list,
                                          java.lang.String substring,
                                          boolean caseinsensitive)
Determines if a substring in an array of strings is present in at least one string of that array. String substring is the substring to search for.

Parameters:
list - The list of elements to use
substring - The substring to search for in the list
caseinsensitive - If true, ignore upper/lowercase distinctions.
Returns:
boolean True if we found a matching substring in the specified list.

containsIgnoreCase

public static boolean containsIgnoreCase(java.lang.String text,
                                         java.lang.String s2)
Performs a case-insensitive java.lang.String.contains() operation.

Parameters:
text - main body of text to check.
s2 - we will try to check if s2 is contained in text.
Returns:
True if s2 was found, case-insensitive, in text.

loadFromFile

public static java.lang.String[] loadFromFile(java.lang.String file,
                                              java.lang.String prefix)
                                       throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
Loads list of pages contained in a file into an array. One newline per item.

Parameters:
file - The abstract filename of the file to load from.
prefix - Append prefix/namespace to items? If not, specify "".
Returns:
The resulting array
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the specified file was not found.

isUploadable

public static boolean isUploadable(java.lang.String f)
Determines if a file is uploadable to a WMF Wiki. Uploadable files currently are (png|gif|jpg|jpeg|xcf|mid|ogg|ogv|svg|djvu|tiff|tif|oga|pdf).

Parameters:
f - The filename to check
Returns:
True if the file is uploadable to a WMF wiki.

Reverses an array of Objects.

Parameters:
array - The array to create a reversed shallow copy of.
Returns:
The reversed array (shallow copy of 'array').

                                         java.lang.String[] a2)

Parameters:
a1 - The first array
a2 - The second array
Returns:

offsetTime

public static java.util.GregorianCalendar offsetTime(int days)
Returns a Gregorian Calendar offset by a given number of days from the current system clock. Use positive int to offset by future days and negative numbers to offset to days before. Automatically set to UTC.

Parameters:
days - The number of days to offset by -/+. Use 0 for no offset.
Returns:
The newly modified calendar.

fetchDateUTC

public static java.lang.String fetchDateUTC(java.lang.String format,
                                            int offset)
Outputs the date/time in UTC. Based on the format and offset in days.

Parameters:
format - Must be specified in accordance with java.text.DateFormat.
offset - The offset from the current time, in days. Accepts positive values (for future), negative values (for past), and 0 for no offset.
Returns:
The formatted date string.

fileToString

public static java.lang.String fileToString(java.io.File f)
                                     throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
Reads the contents of a file into a String. Use with a .txt files for best results. There seems to be an issue with reading in non-standard ascii characters at the moment.

Parameters:
f - The file to read from
Returns:
The contents of the file as a String.
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the file specified does not exist.

listify

public static java.lang.String[] listify(java.lang.String s,
                                         java.lang.String... ignorelist)
Parses a String, assumed to be a list, into a String array. Each item in the list must be separated by a newline character. Space characters are ignored. The ignore list is case sensitive, and only checks if each String in the list starts with the specified text; this is useful for parsing out comments and/or unwanted crap.

Parameters:
s - The String to use (must be delimited by new line chars)
ignorelist - If an item in the list starts with a String in this list, it won't be included in the final result. Whatever you do, don't put an empty string in here; you'll be sorry :3
